Subjective: Stress-related symptoms for months, worse daily for last 2 weeks. Main symptoms: body tension, stiff muscles, heart palpitations, and rapid breathing. Palpitations are fast, regular, felt in neck; occur at rest, not with exertion; last ~30 mins. Rapid breathing feels like SOB, occurs spontaneously. Difficulty falling asleep due to worrying about work; sleeps ~6 hrs on work nights, feels tired. Symptoms triggered by high-stress job (doctor in internal medicine), understaffing, and difficulty saying no. Reducing coffee helps slightly. No chest pain, irregular heartbeat, dizziness, light-headedness, or abdominal complaints. Social: Doctor, lives with housemates (also doctors), good support system. No smoking/alcohol mentioned. Request: Rule out physical cause (e.g., anemia) and discuss seeing a professional.
Objective: Vitals: BP 120/60, HR 65, O2 Sat 98%, RR 14. General: Calm. Heart: Normal heart sounds, no murmurs. Lungs: Clear to auscultation bilaterally, good breath sounds, no adventitious sounds. Abdomen: Exam deferred, no complaints.
Assessment: Stress-related physical symptoms, secondary to work-related stress/overload. Somatic causes to be ruled out.
Plan: Diagnostics: Blood tests ordered (Hemoglobin, thyroid function, liver/kidney function).
Referral: To mental health nurse for consultation; can book appointment immediately.
Advice: Reassured re: normal physical exam. Advised to actively schedule relaxation moments, maintain routine, and consider contacting occupational health doctor at hospital for schedule adjustments.
Follow-up/Safety Net: Blood results in 2 working days (call or check portal). Return if symptoms worsen or new concerns arise.
